user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_lookup_header_token_ci:
```c
static bool
MHD_lookup_header_token_ci (const struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                            const char *header,
                            size_t header_len,
                            const char *token,
                            size_t token_len)
{
  struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos;

  if ((NULL == connection) || (NULL == header) || (0 == header[0]) ||
      (NULL == token) || (0 == token[0]))
    return false;

  for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)
  {
    if ((0 != (pos->kind & MHD_HEADER_KIND)) &&
        (header_len == pos->header_size) &&
        ( (header == pos->header) ||
          (MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_ (header,
                                          pos->header,
                                          header_len)) ) &&
        (MHD_str_has_token_caseless_ (pos->value, token, token_len)))
      return true;
  }
  return false;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No function parameter is modified in this function. Specifically:
- The pointer parameter 'connection' is only dereferenced (connection->rq.headers_received) — it is not assigned to or changed.
- The pointer parameters 'header' and 'token' are only read (checked for NULL and checked header[0]/token[0]) and passed to helper functions; they are not reassigned or modified.
- The size parameters 'header_len' and 'token_len' are only used for comparisons and are not modified.
- The loop uses a local variable 'pos' which is assigned and updated (pos = pos->next); this is a local variable, not a parameter.
- No assignment, increment/decrement, or pointer arithmetic is performed on any parameter variable.

Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 (modifying function parameters).
